DOC.detailed_description: PRIMARY OBJECTIVES : I . Develop evaluate usability cancer-specific motivational tool mobile application ( app ) . ( Phase 1 ) II . Evaluate feasibility technology-enhanced ( electronic accelerometer + app + 8 weekly group session ) fitness program pilot randomize clinical trial . ( Phase 2 ) SECONDARY OBJECTIVES : I . Determine effectiveness technology-enhanced fitness program participant ' cardiorespiratory fitness muscular fitness . II . Examine effect program secondary outcome health relate quality life ( HRQOL ) fatigue . OUTLINE : PHASE I : Participants attend individual small group interview provide input desire feature app . After usable app develop , participant wear electronic accelerometer , use mobile app , may engage private social support message individual study . Participants may undergo individual one time interview , perform usability test 1-2 hour , perform field trial use app 1 week . PHASE II : Participants randomize 1 2 arm . ARM I ( TEENS LIVING WITH CANCER - FITNESS IMPROVEMENT TRAINING [ TLC FIT ] ) : Participants attend 8 group meeting 90 minute weekly , wear electronic accelerometer , engage private social support message within app Facebook private group , use mobile app 4 week without in-person group . ARM II ( WAIT-LIST CONTROL [ WLC ] ) : After 6 month assessment , participant receive TLC FIT intervention arm I .
